name: market for paper, woodcontaining, supercalendered | paper, woodcontaining, supercalendered | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3376/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents the European market for supercalendered paper (SC paper). It includes estimates for average transport requirements from producing to using entity. SC Paper is a non-coated (i.e. no coating with a coating material like kaolin or calcium carbonate) type of mechanical paper which means that less than 90% of the fibres are in form of chemical pulp. Like lightweight coated (LWC) paper, it is mainly used for print materials such as magazines and journals that require a higher paper quality than newsprint paper. 

This dataset starts with the SC paper leaving the gate of the producing entity, ready for distribution to using entities

This dataset includes the average transport from the production site to a central distribution site for the domestic and the foreign SC paper consumed in Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for railway transport of goods. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf "Railway transport - goods transported, by group of goods - from 2008 onwards based on NST 2007 (1 000 t, million tkm) (rail_go_grpgood)" (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media" in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of railway transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 346 km. The fraction of goods transported by rail (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 7.4% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by rail in 2016 was 25.7 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for road freight transport. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Annual road freight transport, by type of goods and type of transport [1 000 t, Mio Tkm], from 2008 onwards (road_go_ta_tg)' (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media" in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of road transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 203 km. The fraction of goods transported by road (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 91.8% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by road in 2016 was 187 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.")

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for transport of goods by inland waterways. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf "Transport by type of good (from 2007 onwards with NST2007) (iww_go_atygo)" (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media" in the year 2016 for the European Union (current composition). The average distance of transport by inland waterways for goods in this category in 2016 was 348 km. The fraction of goods transported by inland waterways (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 0.7% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by inland waterways in 2016 was 2.5 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.
